channel.title: Second State Functions on Second State News and Articles
channel.description: Recent content in Second State Functions on Second State News and Articles

item.title: The SSVM 0.7 release brings WebAssembly to the public cloud
item.description: The SSVM (Second State VM) is a popular WebAssembly VM optimized for high-performance applications on the server side. With advanced AOT (Ahead of Time compiler) support, the SSVM is already one of the fastest WebAssembly VMs. The recent SSVM release 0.7 brings a wide array of unique features that further differentiate and solidify the SSVM as a leading cloud native application runtime. WebAssembly proposals The SSVM supports optional WebAssembly features and proposals.

item.title: Second State Functions releases a developer preview for high performance serverless functions
item.description: Second State has recently released a developer preview of its Function-as-a-Service (FaaS), known as Second State Functions. The Second State Functions enables developers to write simple functions in the Rust programming language for computationally intensive tasks such as image processing and AI inference. The developer simply needs to upload the compiled function to the FaaS service, and the function will become publically available as a web service. The developer preview version of the Second State Functions is free to use.
